reviews.review_msg: Emrul is an upbeat guy which is pretty refreshing for a 4th year econometrics course. Stay on top/ahead of the readings (seriously) and go to lecture, ask questions and you will be fine. There aren't any curveballs, just do the work required well. Emrul himself is friendly and tries to divert some time to practical uses of theory which is helpful

Emrul cares about his students and focuses on the useful and applicable aspects of econometrics rather than on convoluted details. For instance, he highlighted the importance of following past literature and using similar control variables. I found that advice, and others he gave us extremely applicable while writing my ECON 490 thesis.

ECON 425 with Emrul was my favourite course. It is a good mix of theoretical and applied. Emrul emphasizes the real-world and intuitive meaning behind numbers and not just surface level understanding. He also made sure to incorporate real life case studies and experiments which was very useful to learn about.

I would highly recommend taking a class with Emrul. He truly cares about his students and will take the time and effort to make sure they understand a concept. He makes you work hard for your marks, but he is always clear about what to expect on a test or exam. Wish I had taken more courses with him.

Emrul has been the best prof I've had at UBC! He's so passionate about his students' success. Taught practical things that we can use in our career and focused on really helping us understand what we need to know. Gave me a great foundation for graduate courses, and helped so much with my 490 paper by giving econometrics ideas and new techniques.
Emrul works hard for students and he is very eager to help after class. Highly recommended.
